item.title: Decimal Difference in Input VAT Total vs. Item Total in Purchase Transactions
item.dc:creator: Pejay
item.description:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm encountering a recurring issue in Purchase Order ‚Üí Purchase Receipt ‚Üí Purchase Invoice where there‚Äôs always a small decimal difference (‚Ç±0.01 or ‚Ç±0.02) between the total item amount and the Input VAT total.

Here‚Äôs a recent example:

  • Total Items (Gross Amount): ‚Ç±23,205.00

  • Net Total: ‚Ç±20,718.76

  • Input VAT (12%): ‚Ç±2,486.25

    • Computed Total: ‚Ç±23,205.01 (should be ‚Ç±23,205.00)

  • Withholding Tax (1%): ‚Ç±207.19

    • Total after EWT: ‚Ç±22,997.82

As shown in the screenshot, the Input VAT total differs by ‚Ç±0.01 from the total items amount.
This happens quite often, especially when VAT and EWT are both applied.

Issue:

The decimal difference appears during rounding ‚Äî either on the per-line item level or when ERPNext computes tax on net totals.
When multiple taxes are involved, these rounding discrepancies accumulate, causing mismatches between:

  • Purchase Order

  • Purchase Receipt

  • Purchase Invoice

Expected Behavior:

The Input VAT total should match the gross total of items exactly (no decimal difference).

Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Create a Purchase Order with a total of ‚Ç±23,205.00 and apply 12% Input VAT and 1% EWT.

  2. Save and check the computed tax totals.

  3. You‚Äôll see the Input VAT total becomes ‚Ç±23,205.01 instead of ‚Ç±23,205.00.

Environment:

  • ERPNext Version: (v15.45.4)

  • Frappe Version: (v15.81.0)

  • Currency Precision: 2

  • Global Defaults: Checked: Disable Rounded Total

Question:

Is there a way to synchronize rounding precision between the item total and computed tax total so that all documents (PO, PR, PI) remain consistent?

I‚Äôve attached a screenshot showing the discrepancy.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Decimal Difference in Input VAT Total vs. Item Total in Purchase Transactions

item.title: "Sales Invoice Posting Date Time cannot be before Delivery Note Posting Date" Error
item.dc:creator: anant.acharya
item.description:
Hi, I‚Äôm facing a unique problem. I am getting the following error while creating a sales invoice from a delivery note.

Sales Invoice Posting Date Time (08/11/2025 14:53:03) cannot be before Delivery Note Posting Date.
DN # : DCH/S/2526/00680
DN Posting Date & Time: 08/11/2025 09:41:22

However, as the message shows, the delivery note posting is before the Sales Invoice posting date. (In our instance, the users are not allowed to create backdated invoices.) Hence, technically the issue shouldnt come.

I tried going through the source code but I could not find where this error is coming from.

We tried this throughout the same day but same error kept coming. Then the next day, we tried again and in the first attempt, the invoice got created without any issues.

This made me think that while the message shows both date and time, only the date parts are being compared, and the time parts are being ignored.

Am I bonkers in thinking like this? Has anyone else faced this problem? and if so, Is there a solution for this? I‚Äôd really appreciate some help here.

8 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: "Sales Invoice Posting Date Time cannot be before Delivery Note Posting Date" Error

item.title: Transfer Asset Between Companies with Related Accounting Entries (Depreciation JEs, etc.)
item.dc:creator: Pejay
item.description:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm exploring whether ERPNext has a built-in feature or workflow that supports transferring an Asset from one Company to another ‚Äî specifically, along with all its linked accounting entries (such as Depreciation Journal Entries).

Here‚Äôs the use case:

  • An asset is created under Company A and has already gone through depreciation posting.

  • The asset has multiple Journal Entries linked to it (depreciation, adjustments, etc.).

  • When performing an Asset Transfer, I‚Äôd like the system to also reflect the transfer in accounting ‚Äî meaning:

    • The company field in all related accounting entries (e.g., Journal Entries) should change to Company B.

    • The accounts used should also map to Company B‚Äôs chart of accounts.

Essentially, I want to ensure that the asset and its entire accounting trail are properly reflected under the new company after transfer.

I‚Äôve checked the existing Asset Transfer workflow but it seems to only handle asset-level movement (location, cost center, etc.), not the associated GL entries.

Is there an existing feature, hook, or best practice for this type of cross-company asset transfer with accounting adjustments?
Or would this require a custom implementation (e.g., a script to re-create or re-map the JEs under the target company)?

Any reference, documentation, or implementation insight would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

5 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Transfer Asset Between Companies with Related Accounting Entries (Depreciation JEs, etc.)

item.title: üöÄ Introducing Frappe/ERPNext Docker Manager ‚Äì a fully automated solution to set up and manage your
item.dc:creator: devinvento
item.description:
GitHub: GitHub - devinvento/frappe-erpnext-docker-manager

What It Does

This project automates the entire process of installing, configuring, and managing Frappe/ERPNext using Docker ‚Äî with a single, interactive script.
No more manual setup or long commands ‚Äî just run it, and your stack is ready!

Key Features

  • Fully Automated Setup: Installs Docker, Bench, and dependencies automatically.
  • Simple Commands: Start, stop, restart, or update containers easily.
  • Multi-Site & App Support: Create multiple sites and install custom apps in seconds.
  • Environment Isolation: Keeps your ERPNext instance stable and clean.
  • Backup & Restore Tools: Easy data safety options included.

Perfect For

Developers, DevOps engineers, and ERPNext administrators who want:

  • Faster deployment on any server (Ubuntu-based)
  • Hassle-free updates and maintenance
  • A reliable, repeatable installation experience

Open Source & Actively Developed

I‚Äôm continuously improving the project ‚Äî feedback, issues, and contributions are very welcome!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: üöÄ Introducing Frappe/ERPNext Docker Manager ‚Äì a fully automated solution to set up and manage your

item.title: How to configure combined item in production
item.dc:creator: trainingacademy
item.description:
Hi

Here is the setup‚Ä¶

An item is sold as a combined item i.e. male and female connector. Sold in a pack.
My BOM requires that they be two separate items i.e. ‚Äúmale‚Äù and ‚Äúfemale‚Äù. Yes, I can
use STE = Repack to split the combined item into two items, but that us then done
manually before the production. Is there a way to handle this via a BOM configuration ?

One way i was thinking is to set up a BOM that renders the combined item as the input item ( raw material ) and the ‚Äúmale‚Äù as the ‚Äúproduced‚Äù item with the ‚Äúfemale‚Äù landing up in the scrap store. In which case a STE transfer is required to put the ‚Äúfemale‚Äù into the main Store. So its not ideal but can work.

Any suggestions please ?

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: How to configure combined item in production

item.title: Auto Repeat task returns OK, but no entries are created (Bug?)
item.dc:creator: ChipwizBen
item.description:
Suddenly, and without any apparent change, all Auto Repeat jobs of all kinds have stopped working. The version of ERPNext has not changed between the successful creation and the unsuccessful creation, and the system has not been updated either. I first noticed it today after September‚Äôs month-end invoices did not auto-create.

If I run ‚ÄúExecute‚Äù on the frappe.automation.doctype.auto_repeat.auto_repeat.make_auto_repeat_entry job, the ‚ÄúScheduled Job Log‚Äù shows a successful execution, and the log file also has some entries that are relevant to the files that would otherwise get created:

2025-10-04 15:45:15,511 home-erp-frappe-bench:default: frappe.utils.background_jobs.execute_job(event=None, is_async=True, job_name='frappe.core.doctype.scheduled_job_type.scheduled_job_type.run_scheduled_jo..., kwargs={'job_type': 'frappe.automation.doctype.auto_repeat.auto_repeat.make_auto_r..., method='frappe.core.doctype.scheduled_job_type.scheduled_job_type.run_scheduled_jo..., site='erp', user='me') (erp::scheduled_job::frappe.automation.doctype.auto_repeat.auto_repeat.make_auto_repeat_entry)
2025-10-04 15:45:15,898 home-erp-frappe-bench:default: Job OK (erp::scheduled_job::frappe.automation.doctype.auto_repeat.auto_repeat.make_auto_repeat_entry)
2025-10-04 15:45:15,899 Result is kept for 600 seconds
2025-10-04 15:45:15,903 home-erp-frappe-bench:default: frappe.utils.background_jobs.execute_job(event=None, is_async=True, job_name='frappe.automation.doctype.auto_repeat.auto_repeat.create_repeated_entries', kwargs={'data': [{'name': 'OnCall Transfer'}, {'name': 'Vultr'}, {'name': 'AUT-AR-..., method='frappe.automation.doctype.auto_repeat.auto_repeat.create_repeated_entries', site='erp', user='me') (352a1570-583a-4639-b535-63dba295f32d)
2025-10-04 15:45:16,220 home-erp-frappe-bench:default: Job OK (352a1570-583a-4639-b535-63dba295f32d)
2025-10-04 15:45:16,220 Result is kept for 600 seconds

I reverted back to several old backups just to make sure that the system hadn‚Äôt been changed, even as far back as April, but oddly no new Auto Repeat entries are created even when I run Execute from a backup job in April. So either I don‚Äôt understand what that ‚ÄúExecute‚Äù button does, or there‚Äôs something else going on.

Can somebody please tell me how to run an execution task to create missed Auto Repeat tasks?

And can somebody offer some insight into what the heck is going on and why the system would suddenly stop behaving correctly without any change to it?

ERPNext: v14.74.7 (version-14)
Frappe Framework: v14.83.0 (version-14)
Frappe HR: v14.34.1 (version-14)

10 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Auto Repeat task returns OK, but no entries are created (Bug?)

item.title: When master data changes, which values should forms display?
item.dc:creator: Saralrat
item.description:
Problem statement

Users often update master data (e.g., customer name, billing/shipping address, item name/description) while transactions (quotations, sales orders, invoices, delivery notes, etc.) are being created or after they‚Äôve been submitted.

Question

When master data changes, which values should forms use?

  • A. Latest master data ‚Äî always pull current values at render
  • B. Document snapshot ‚Äî use values saved on the document; never auto-refresh after submit

Thank you.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: When master data changes, which values should forms display?
